duck: Exemption (church), an exemption in the Roman Catholic Church, that is the whole or partial release of an ecclesiastical person, corporation, or institution from the authority of the ecclesiastical superior next higher in rank
Exempt employee, is one who is exempt from the Fair Labor Standards Act, i. e. is not entitled to overtime pay and other worker's benefits stated in the FLSA
An exemption such as a tax exemption allows a certain amount of income or other value to be legally excluded to avoid or reduce taxation.
exemption definition: the act of exempting or state of being exempt.
Loophole, a weakness or exception that allows a system, such as a law or security, to be circumvented or otherwise avoided.
Grandfather clause, an exemption that allows a pre-existing condition to continue, even if such a condition is now prohibited from being begun anew

milestones: NZ law exempts working farm dogs from embedded ID tag rule
Minnesota Department of Health says 'theatre nights' in bars are not exempt from Freedom to Breathe Act
Cheney lobbies for CIA exemption to torture ban
Maine passes gay rights law
The Tel Aviv Magistrates Court sentences Omri Sharon
US pastors plan to defy law and endorse candidates
Canadian government threatens to ignore law respecting Kyoto Protocol
Brazilian Medicine Council against Cuban privileges
Nepal Parliament passes resolution to curb King's power
UK court rules Pringles are potato-light
Senator Xenophon of Australia calls for criminal investigation into Scientology
Burma introduces military draft
Proposed bill could force federal weather data offline
USA tracks information on travelers
'Purity' ring case taken to High Court
US announces revised limits on use of nuclear weapons
Ex-head of Qantas freight operations in US jailed for price fixing
New Zealand's copyright bill report strikes criticism
British Parliament bans smoking in pubs, workplaces and clubs
Formula One: Renault dismisses Piquet, Schumacher barred from practising

wiki.text:
An exemption such as a tax exemption allows a certain amount of income or other
value to be legally excluded to avoid or reduce taxation.

'Exemption' may also refer to:

* Exemption (church), an exemption in the Roman Catholic Church, that is
  the whole or partial release of an ecclesiastical person, corporation,
  or institution from the authority of the ecclesiastical superior next
  higher in rank
* Grandfather clause, an exemption that allows a pre-existing condition to
  continue, even if such a condition is now prohibited from being begun anew
* Exempt employee, is one who is exempt from the Fair Labor Standards Act, i. e.
  is not entitled to overtime pay and other worker's benefits stated in the FLSA
* Loophole, a weakness or exception that allows a system, such as a law or
  security, to be circumvented or otherwise avoided.
wiki.title: exemption
